title: PIMCO lines up brokers for ASX-listed fund
text:
Global bond giant PIMCO is believed to be mulling a $1 billion-odd listed credit fund that would be pitched to domestic retail investors and trade on the Australian Securities Exchange.

Street Talk understands PIMCO is seeking a larger slice of the Australian retail investor dollar and is working on a proposed listed fund or trust that would market early in the new year.

Partners Group raised $550 million for an ASX-listed credit fund that hit the boards in September, while KKR's $925 million fund is due to start trading next month. Peter Braig

It is understood PIMCO is in talks with brokers to arrange and help sell the deal to retail investors, with sources pointing to National Australia Bank's well-regarded unit as most likely to handle the offer.

PIMCO is locked in a race with a handful of other global heavyweights who are said to be mulling similar offers. Brokers are being encouraged to sign up to exclusively manage PIMCO's offer, sources said.

The potential ASX-listed fund would be pitched at retail investors and invest in a handful of PIMCO's underlying funds. The money manager is one of the world's biggest fixed-income investors with more than $2.5 trillion in assets.
description: PIMCO is believed to be mulling a $1 billion-odd listed credit fund that would trade on the ASX.
